did.unittitle: Philadelphia Museum of Art Conservation records

bioghist.p: The Conservation Department was established in 1966 under Theodor Siegl, who was initially hired as a part-time conservator in 1955. Prior to Siegl's assuming his position as full-time conservator, individual conservators were contracted as needed. From 1955 to 1966, Siegl and his growing staff of assistants were aligned with the Painting and Sculpture Department. In 1978 Marigene Butler became Conservator and also in 1978 a new Conservation Laboratory was opened.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Theodor Siegl, Conservator. Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence to museum staff, fellow conservators, and professional organizations; conference materials from meetings of the American Institute for Conservation and the International Institute for Conservation, including agendas, minutes, reports, and member directories; IIC newsletters (1954-1959 and 1960-1963). The collection also includes some Conservation Department records created after Siegl's retirement.
